full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 ED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTINE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION ADMINISTRATIVE PAGE TITLE FILE NUMBER MAO, Pei-Ing A17 181 791 aka MAO, Betty REPORT NUMBER DATE 7/8/69 PLACE CENTRAL OFFICE AND REGIONAL REFERENCES 1 (6/18/69 kk) LOS CONTROL OFFICE TRANSFERRED TO: G-23 LINE TYPE OF INVESTIGATION Fraud - Labor Cer- LOS 503 REPORTABLE tification - Deportation DATE AND PLACE OF BIRTH NATIONALITY DATE, PLACE AND MANNER OF ENTRY October 27, 1914, in China China January 17, 1968, at Honolulu, as an immigrant DISTRIBUTION REVIEWED AND APPROVED (SEE COMMENT) DATE PLACE 7/9/69 LOS 1 - File - w/Ex "A" SIGNATURE BRG NAME AND TITLE B. R. Pearson Supervisory General Investigator REVIEWED AND APPROVED (SEE COMMENT) DATE PLACE SIGNATURE the NAME AND TITLE APPROVED (REGIONAL OFFICE) DATE NAME AND TITLE SIGNATURE STATUS OF INVESTIGATION PENDING PENDING INACTIVE X CLOSED REFERRED TO CONTROL OFFICE Investigation conducted after it was ascertained that the SUBJECT had not worked for her petitioning employer following the SUBJECT's admission to the United States as an immigrant. COMMENT It appears that the SUBJECT may be amenable to deportation An application has been submitted for the issuance of an Order to Show Cause alleging that the position that the SUBJECT was to accept in the United States was not in existence when the SUBJECT applied for admission to the United States as an immigrant. The applicable telegraphic code words are: WEBAK, REGOJ Fiver RAZEZ. A July 8, 1969 Philip H. Smith, Investigator THIS PAGE IS NOT TO BE DISTRIBUTED OUTSIDE THE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE FORM G-166A (REV. 6-1-66) FP1-LPC-9-68-22M-4051
